page.title: 04POLICE AND FIRE SERVICE
page.content: {POLICE STATION} The police station was built in 1950 and has since been extended twice. It is owned by Kent County Council and has an average rate of 1 reported crime per day. Altogether there are 15 police workers, 1 typist and 1 cleaner who all live locally. The average working day is eight hours.Two or more police men work nightshift .In Edenbridge the police are just begining to use computers. {FIRE STATION { }Edenbridge Fire Station has one full-time worker and 4 to 6 part-time. On average they attend to 6 fires a week but there is only one fire engine. When a 999 call is made in the area, the call is routed through Maidstone, Sevenoaks and finally Edenbridge. ....by..Andrea Marsh & Kirsty Stenlake
